title: 111_s3340
content: The Act may be cited as the "NIST Grants for Energy Efficiency, New Job Opportunities, and Business Solutions Act of 2010" or the "NIST GREEN JOBS Act of 2010". The Hollings Manufacturing Extension Partnership Program has been valuable in helping companies reinvest in themselves through process improvement and business growth initiatives, leading to more sales, new markets, and technology adoption. Manufacturing is becoming increasingly important in the construction sector, requiring more efficient and precise practices for construction and renovation in the United States. Many small construction companies lack access to innovative techniques and could benefit from training provided by the Manufacturing Extension Partnership. Broadening the competitiveness grant program could help capture significant energy savings in the US building sector. The national interest lies in enhancing the Manufacturing Extension Partnership to support the construction and green energy industries, aiming to elevate energy efficiency levels in US buildings to match those in other countries. SEC. 3. NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STANDARDS AND TECHNOLOGY COMPETITIVE GRANT PROGRAM. The National Institute of Standards and Technology Act is being amended to add capabilities to the MEP program, focusing on projects to increase viability in manufacturing and related sectors. This includes technology transfer and supply chain integration. The National Institute of Standards and Technology Act is being amended to enhance the MEP program by facilitating technology transfer from higher education institutions and other entities to manufacturers. Awards under this program will be peer-reviewed and competitively awarded, with a focus on selecting proposals from different regions of the United States. The National Institute of Standards and Technology Act is being amended to enhance the MEP program by facilitating technology transfer and promoting environmentally focused materials, products, and processes. Awards under this program will create jobs, increase energy efficiency, and improve industry competitiveness in the region. The duration of awards is limited to 3 years, and eligible participants include manufacturing firms. The Centers program awards can be used to assist small or medium-sized construction firms. $7,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2011 to 2014 for this purpose.
